raw_mentions:
An antibody is said to specifically bind an antigen when the dissociation constant is ≦1 mM, preferably ≦100 nM and most preferably ≦10 nM.
In certain embodiments, the K<sub>D </sub>is 1 μM to 500 μM.
In other embodiments, the K<sub>D </sub>is between 500 μM to 1 μM.
In other embodiments, the K<sub>D </sub>is between 1 μM to 100 nM.
In other embodiments, the K<sub>D </sub>is between 100 mM to 10 nM.
